pullRequest.body:
The mathlib style guide states clearly that using \lambda for anonymous functions is disallowed, and the fun keyword is preferred. This linter enforces this.

---

I have decided to call the linter option `linter.style.lambdaSyntax`, fareshadowing the analogous renaming of options in #15971.
This linter is actually pretty simple: most of this PR are detailed tests.

<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>

How about test with lambda used in other kinds of syntax nodes?

> How about test with lambda used in other kinds of syntax nodes?

I just added a lot of tests - which cannot be exhaustive; let me know if a particular kind of tests is missing!
Rebased on master, and disabled this linter by default.

I just noticed that the changes in mathlib are `=>` vs `\mapsto`, though this is not what the linter enforces.  This should not necessarily change, but seems a little odd to modify code that the linter does not flag.
Thanks for the suggestions, Damiano! I implemented all of them (tweaking the `stx` one slightly), and updated the tests.
maintainer merge
ðŸš€ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by adomani.

:v: grunweg can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).
bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10559323991/job/29250528015)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10559323991/job/29250527681)
bors d+
Just a very small stylistic suggestion: with the change, just `Î»` should be underlined, with the current implementation, the whole `Î» x => ...` gets underlined.
bors d+

Note that this approach does not allow:
```
example : â„• â†’ â„• := set_option linter.lambdaSyntax false in Î» _ â†¦ 0
```
which would require walking the infotree instead.
Good point! Not supporting this seems fine to me, but I have added a test to this effect.

```suggestion
      | ``Parser.Term.fun => dargs.push stx[0]
```
If from here you extract the `atom` directly...

```suggestion
      if let .atom _ "Î»" := s then
        Linter.logLint linter.style.lambdaSyntax s m!"\
```
... then here you can simply log the warning on the `Î»` more easily.

```suggestion
This is syntactically equivalent to the `fun` keyword; mathlib style prefers using the latter.
-/
```

```suggestion
        The 'Î»'-syntax is deprecated in mathlib4."
```
Just to be more explicit.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: the lambdaSyntax linter
